result.execSummary:
The defendant Charlene E Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: DE to make arrangements with the jail for serving her time.

Upon failure to pay, the Court may;

 Enter a civil judgment
 Intercept your income taxes
 Suspend your driving privilege on TR/CT cases
 Send debt to Department of Revenue.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charlene E Smith

records.addlTxt:
1:15 PM Defendant Charlene E Smith appeared by video.  Attorney Luke J Fischer Sr. appeared by video for Charlene E Smith.  Attorney Emily Nelson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Heard along with 22C33, 22CT5.  22CT5-DE working on obtaining her DL, Atty asking for additional time to allow this.  

22CM33-Agreement reached in this matter.  Court has colloquy with DE on her right to in person court appearance, DE will waive, wishes to proceed today.

Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE advised of Constitutional Rights, Factual basis/ PC found, plea freely, knowingly, voluntarily, intelligently made, court accepts plea NC, finds DE guilty. 

DE will serve 5 days jail, pay a fine of $350.00/plus CC, 1 year revocation of DL, install IID for 1 year, complete an AODA assessment/follow up, pay rest of $23.50. 

Sentencing argument entered by parties. Atty Fischer asking the court to stay jail time until 10/28/22 and allow DE time complete jail time in 2 weekends.  DE has credit for 1 day. Court will adopt the proposed agreement.  DE may make the arrangements with the jail for serving jail ordered. Adj 1:45
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:08 PM Defendant Charlene E Smith in court.  Attorney Luke J Fischer Sr. appeared by video for Charlene E Smith.  Attorney Emily Nelson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Heard along with 22CM33 and 22CT5.  Agreement has been reached, Atty asking for P/S date. Adj 2:11pm
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Review hearing on September 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Review hearing on September 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Review hearing on September 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician. Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid operating privilege.

1:26 PM Defendant Charlene E Smith in court.  Attorney Emily Margaret Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Luke J Fischer Sr. in court for Charlene E Smith. Heard along with 22CM33, 22CT5. Waive reading of the CC, enter plea of NG to misdemeanor counts. 

$2500.00 sign bond, Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician. Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid operating privilege. 

Set for RH September 6, 2022 @ 2:00PM. Adj 1:28pm
